# Seventh grade

From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia

Jump to: navigation, search

[![](//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png)](/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg) | This article **needs additional citations for[verification](/wiki/Wikipedia:Verifiability "Wikipedia:Verifiability")**. **Seventh grade** (called [Year 8](/wiki/Year_8 "Year 8") in the
[England](/wiki/England "England") and [Wales](/wiki/Wales "Wales"), called
First Year in [Scotland](/wiki/Scotland "Scotland")) is a year of
[education](/wiki/Education "Education") in many nations. The seventh grade is
the seventh school year after [kindergarten](/wiki/Kindergarten
"Kindergarten"). Students are usually 12–13 years old.

## Around the
world[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=1 "Edit
section: Around the world")]

### United
States[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=2 "Edit
section: United States")]

In the United States, in [math](/wiki/Math "Math"), students focus commonly on
an introduction to [pre-algebra](/wiki/Pre-algebra "Pre-algebra") or the
beginnings of [algebra](/wiki/Algebra_I "Algebra I") including
[ratio](/wiki/Ratio "Ratio"),
[proportion](/wiki/Proportionality_\(mathematics\) "Proportionality
\(mathematics\)"), and [percent](/wiki/Percent "Percent"). New topics
sometimes include [scientific notation](/wiki/Scientific_notation "Scientific
notation"), concepts with [negative numbers](/wiki/Negative_number "Negative
number"), and more advanced [geometry](/wiki/Geometry "Geometry").[1]

In [social studies](/wiki/Social_studies "Social studies"), advanced
pre-[Civil War](/wiki/American_Civil_War "American Civil War")
[History](/wiki/History "History") is taught. Though American history is
usually the norm, other cultures and time periods may be taught.[2]

In [science](/wiki/Science "Science"), it is usually moderate-level
[biology](/wiki/Biology "Biology"). In some parts of the United States,
seventh grade is the first school year in which students have different
[teachers](/wiki/Teachers "Teachers") for each of their
[subjects](/wiki/Course_\(education\) "Course \(education\)"), and so they
change [classrooms](/wiki/Classrooms "Classrooms") at the end of each
[period](/wiki/Period_\(school\) "Period \(school\)"). [Foreign
language](/wiki/Foreign_language "Foreign language") is often introduced at
this level. The students can typically choose from several
[languages](/wiki/Languages "Languages") depending on school ability.

### Great
Britain[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=3 "Edit
section: Great Britain")]

In [England](/wiki/England "England") and [Wales](/wiki/Wales "Wales"), pupils
aged between 12 and 13 are in [Year 8](/wiki/Year_8 "Year 8") which is the
second year of [Secondary School](/wiki/Secondary_School "Secondary School").
The [Scottish](/wiki/Education_in_Scotland "Education in Scotland") equivalent
is Secondary 1 or S1 - the first year of Secondary education. The [Northern
Irish](/wiki/Education_in_Northern_Ireland "Education in Northern Ireland")
equivalent is Year 9 or Second Form, the second year of secondary education.

### Hong Kong[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=4
"Edit section: Hong Kong")]

In [Hong Kong](/wiki/Hong_Kong "Hong Kong"), pupils aged 12 to 14 are in
_[Secondary 2](/wiki/Education_in_Hong_Kong "Education in Hong Kong")_ or
_Form 2_ , the second year of secondary education.

### Australia[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=5
"Edit section: Australia")]

In some states of [Australia](/wiki/Australia "Australia") including
[Victoria](/wiki/Victoria_\(Australia\) "Victoria \(Australia\)"), [New South
Wales](/wiki/New_South_Wales "New South Wales"), [Australian Capital
Territory](/wiki/Australian_Capital_Territory "Australian Capital Territory"),
and [Tasmania](/wiki/Tasmania "Tasmania"), Year 7 is the first year of
[secondary school](/wiki/High_school "High school"), but it is actually the
eighth year of schooling (Prep/Kindergarten, 1 through 6 then Year 7). In
Australia, Year 7 students are aged 12–13 years old.

### Ireland[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=6
"Edit section: Ireland")]

The [Irish](/wiki/Education_in_the_Republic_of_Ireland "Education in the
Republic of Ireland") equivalent to seventh grade is First Year, which is the
first year of secondary education. Students are usually 12-13 years old.

### Iran[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=7 "Edit
section: Iran")]

In [Iran](/wiki/Iran "Iran"), Grade 7 is the first year of Highschool A. There
are 2 stages of Highschool in Iran: A and B. A ranges from grade 7 to 9 and B
ranges from 9 to 12. Most of Iranian 7 graders are 13 years old.

### Brazil[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=8 "Edit
section: Brazil")]

In [Brazil](/wiki/Brazil "Brazil"), the time for elementary school was
recently raised from 8 to 9 years, and the minimum age required to enter the
seventh grade was changed from 11 to 12 years old. The students are usually
between 12 and 13 years old.

### Bulgaria[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=9
"Edit section: Bulgaria")]

In [Bulgaria](/wiki/Bulgaria "Bulgaria"), it would correspond to _седми клас_
or _7-ми клас_. Students are usually 13 years old.

### Philippines[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=10
"Edit section: Philippines")]

In the [Philippines](/wiki/Philippines "Philippines"), Grade 7 is the first
year of Junior High School. Topics mainly discussed are the following subjects
like, for the major subjects are Elementary-based Algebra (Math in Grade 7),
Integrated Science (Science in Grade 7), Filipino subject with [Ibong
Adarna](/wiki/Ibong_Adarna "Ibong Adarna"), English and Philippines History
(Political Studies in Grade 7). Values Education, World Literature, MAPEH
(Music, Arts, Physical Education and Health), Computer and TLE (Technology and
Livelihood Education) are some of the minor subjects. Students are usually
12–13 years old.

### Israel[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=11
"Edit section: Israel")]

In [Israel](/wiki/Education_in_Israel "Education in Israel"), in most formal
places, the seventh grade is the first year of [middle
school](/wiki/Middle_school "Middle school").

### South
Africa[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=12 "Edit
section: South Africa")]

In [South Africa](/wiki/South_Africa "South Africa"), Grade 7 is the final
year of [primary school](/wiki/Primary_school "Primary school") and is also
the final year before [High School](/wiki/High_School "High School") as there
is no such thing as [Middle School](/wiki/Middle_School "Middle School") in
South Africa. Pupils (called Learners by the [Department of
Education](/wiki/Department_of_Education_\(South_Africa\) "Department of
Education \(South Africa\)")) are usually between the ages of 11,12 and 13.

### Sweden and
Finland[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=13 "Edit
section: Sweden and Finland")]

In [Sweden](/wiki/Sweden "Sweden") and [Finland](/wiki/Finland "Finland"),
this is the seventh year of compulsory school and the first year of "junior
high".

### New Zealand[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=14
"Edit section: New Zealand")]

In [New Zealand](/wiki/New_Zealand "New Zealand"), the equivalent is Year 8.
It is the final year of education at either intermediate school (which is Year
7 & 8) or a full primary school. (A normal primary school finishes at Year 6).
Students are usually 12 to 13 years old. There are some high schools that
start at Year 7.

### South Asia[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=15
"Edit section: South Asia")]

In [India](/wiki/India "India"), [Pakistan](/wiki/Pakistan "Pakistan") and
other [South Asian Countries](/wiki/South_Asia "South Asia"), grade seven is
called Class Seven and forms middle school.

### Singapore[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=16
"Edit section: Singapore")]

In [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore "Singapore"), seventh grade is called Secondary
One, and it is the start of one's secondary education after one completes
primary education. Pupils are typically at the age of 13 in seventh grade.

### France[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=17
"Edit section: France")]

In [France](/wiki/France "France"), seventh grade is called 5ème (5 years
before Terminale, where most students take the Baccalauréat). 5ème is the
second year of French secondary school, which is call collège.

### Romania[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=18
"Edit section: Romania")]

In [Romania](/wiki/Romania "Romania"), seventh grade is called Seventh Class.

### Canada[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=19
"Edit section: Canada")]

The elementary school curriculum varies with the organisation and educational
aims of individual schools and local communities. Promotion from one grade to
the next is based on testing and a child whose performance is poor may be
required to repeat a year, while a gifted child may be allowed to skip a year.
Elementary schools provide instruction in the fundamental skills of reading,
writing and maths, as well as history, geography, crafts, music, science, art,
and physical education (phys ed. or gym). French and ‘foreign’ languages,
which used to be taught only at high schools, are now introduced during the
last few years of elementary school in some areas and students can enter an
‘early French immersion programme’ at kindergarten or grade 1 level.

### Taiwan[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=20
"Edit section: Taiwan")]

In [Taiwan](/wiki/Taiwan "Taiwan"), seventh grade refers to two things:
students in the first year of [junior-high](/wiki/Junior_high_school "Junior
high school") but also to people born between the years 70-79 (the seventh
decade) of the [Minguo calendar](/wiki/Minguo_calendar "Minguo calendar"),
which equates to between 1981 and 1989.

### Greece[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=21
"Edit section: Greece")]

In [Greece](/wiki/Greece "Greece"), seventh grade is called 1st year of middle
school (1η γυμνασίου in Greek). It is the first year of Greece's middle school
(γυμνάσιο). Students are taught subjects such as: [Physical
Education](/wiki/Physical_Education "Physical Education"),
[Science](/wiki/Science "Science") ([Chemistry](/wiki/Chemistry "Chemistry"),
[Physics](/wiki/Physics "Physics"), [Biology](/wiki/Biology "Biology")),
[Religious Education](/wiki/Religious_Education "Religious Education"), and
language subjects

### Russia[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=22
"Edit section: Russia")]

In [Russia](/wiki/Russia "Russia"), students in seventh grade are usually
12–14 years old. It is third grade of the middle school. Children study such
subjects as: [Algebra](/wiki/Algebra "Algebra"), [Geometry](/wiki/Geometry
"Geometry"), [Russian language](/wiki/Russian_language "Russian language"),
foreign language (often [English](/wiki/English_language "English language")),
[Physics](/wiki/Physics "Physics"), [Biology](/wiki/Biology "Biology"),
[History](/wiki/History "History"), [Social studies](/wiki/Social_studies
"Social studies"), [Geography](/wiki/Geography "Geography"), [Arts](/wiki/Arts
"Arts"), [Literature](/wiki/Literature "Literature"), [Music](/wiki/Music
"Music"), [Physical Education](/wiki/Physical_Education "Physical Education"),
[Information
Technologies](/w/index.php?title=Information_Technologies&action=edit&redlink=1
"Information Technologies \(page does not exist\)"), labour training (wood
processing, sewing, cooking), in some regions native languages.

### The
Netherlands[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=23
"Edit section: The Netherlands")]

In the Netherlands the 7th grade is called "de eerste klas" or "brugklas", the
first year of high school (middle school doesn't exist in the Netherlands,
when you're 12 you go from primary school (basisschool) to high school
(middelbare school) ). After 4/5/6 years (depending on your level of
education) you can get your diploma.

### Malaysia[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=24
"Edit section: Malaysia")]

In [Malaysia](/wiki/Malaysia "Malaysia"), seventh grade can be referred as
Form 1. It is the beginning of student's secondary school after completing
primary school at the age of 13.

### Saudi
Arabia[[edit](/w/index.php?title=Seventh_grade&action=edit&section=25 "Edit
section: Saudi Arabia")]

In [Saudi Arabia](/wiki/Saudi_Arabia "Saudi Arabia"), seventh grade is the
first year of [Middle School](/wiki/Middle_School "Middle School").

qa.question: what grade is 12 years old in usa

m.036z1n_23.Query Analysis: The query seeks to determine the grade level typically associated with 12-year-old students in the USA.
m.036z1n_23.Answer Analysis: The answer indicates that a 12-year-old in the USA is typically in the Seventh grade.
m.036z1n_23.Document Content Analysis: The document provides detailed information about the movie 'Billy Madison', including its genres, release dates, languages, and notable characters. It mentions specific grades (Grade 3 and Grade 12) in the context of character notes.
m.036z1n_23.Document and Query Keywords Matching: The document mentions 'Grade 12', which is a grade level, but does not directly reference age or the USA.
m.036z1n_23.Document and Answer Keywords Matching: The document does not mention 'Seventh grade' or any age-related information directly corresponding to the answer.
m.036z1n_23.Key Information Matching: The document contains references to grade levels but lacks context about the age of students in those grades or the educational system in the USA.
m.036z1n_23.Can the Document Answer the Query: No, the document does not provide information about the typical grade for a 12-year-old in the USA.
m.036z1n_23.Can the Document Help Infer Additional I: No, the document's mention of grades is unrelated to the age or educational system context required by the query.
m.036z1n_23.Explanation: The document is primarily about the movie 'Billy Madison' and includes some references to grades in a fictional context. It does not provide any relevant information about the educational system or age-grade correlations in the USA. Therefore, it is irrelevant to the query.

ott_28170_1.Answer Analysis: The answer indicates that 12-year-old students are typically in the Seventh grade.

ott_28170_1.Document and Query Keywords Matching: The document does not contain any of the extracted query keywords ('grade', '12 years old', 'USA').
ott_28170_1.Document and Answer Keywords Matching: The document mentions 'Year 7', which corresponds to 'Seventh grade', but it is in the context of the Western Australian school system, not the USA.
ott_28170_1.Key Information Matching: While the document mentions 'Year 7', it is specific to the Western Australian education system and does not provide information relevant to the USA.
ott_28170_1.Can the Document Answer the Query: No, the document does not provide information about the USA education system or grade levels.
ott_28170_1.Can the Document Help Infer Additional I: No, the document's focus on the Western Australian school system does not help infer information about the USA education system.
ott_28170_1.Explanation: The document is irrelevant to the query as it focuses on the education system in Western Australia, which does not provide any useful context or information about the grade level of 12-year-old students in the USA.

nq_163054_6.Query Analysis: The query asks for the grade level typically associated with 12-year-old students in the USA.
nq_163054_6.Answer Analysis: The answer indicates that 12-year-old students are usually in the Seventh grade.
